bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 10, 1952

div1.p: Siler is glad Hench will be able to attend the Camp Lazear dedication. He and Love agree with Hench's suggestion to encourage American publications to carry a news item about the dedication.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 10, 1952
div1.opener:
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
----
GORGAS MEMORIAL LABORATORY
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
November 10, 1952
JOSEPH F. SILER
PRESIDENT
MAURICE H. THATCHER
VICE PRESIDENT AND GENERAL COUNSEL
WALTER A. BLOEDORN
SECRETARY
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thanks so much for your letter of November 4th advising me that
“Camp Lazear” is to be dedicated on December 3rd. I am delighted that it
will be possible for you to go down for this occasion.

I note what you have to say about carrying a news item of this in
the MILITARY SURGEON and the ARMED FORCES MEDICAL JOURNAL and I think it is
very important that this be done. General Love and I have talked this matter
over and he is taking it up with Col. Brandtstadt, editor-in-chief of the
Amred Forces Medical Journal and I have just taken it up with Col. Phalen,
editor of the Military Surgeon. I know they will both be glad to carry out
the suggestions which you made.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, J. F. Siler, Col., (MC), USA, Rtd.
President, Walter Reed Memorial Ass'n. jfs k
